      • getConfigProperty

        public String getConfigProperty(javax.servlet.http.HttpSession session,
                                String configName,
                                String propName,
                                String defaultValue)
        This utility function is useful for single property fetches. As is does call the getConfigProperties, it is more efficient to fetch multiple values using the above getConfigProperies to avoid the file modification check on each call.
        Parameters:
        session - the current HttpSession
        configName - the name of the configuration ending with "Prop"
        propName - the property name within the property file
        defaultValue - a default value to return if the named property does not exist
        Returns:
        the refereneced value from the specified properties, or the defaultValue if not found or defined.

      • _description

        public void _description()

        The status.jsp is the primary collector and reporter of status information for zPaper web servers.

        THEORY OF OPERATION

        The status.jsp may be invoked by any of the following methods:
        • Manually from a web browser.
        • Remotely from a 'buddy' status.jsp on a remote server.
        • Remotely from status.jsp on any server to POST a change in server status.
        • Automatically from a cron job and regular intervals.

        Some server and application status is collected directly from the status.jsp, while other status is collected outside of the status.jsp execution, and merely reported by the status.jsp.

        Process Flow
        • Each invocation begins with initialization of ThreadLocal variables used through the code.
        • Authentication is checked to set permissible operations
        • If this is a POST operation:
          • The POST parameters are collected from the request
          • The parameters are POSTed to the newActionUrl (typically: myfileforce/org/newAction.jsp)
          • status.jsp returns immediately
        • If this is a GET operation with a "ping" parameter:
          • The "ping" value is negated and returned as the response.
          • status.jsp returns immediately
        • The following is the main flow once past the above exceptions:
          • Initialize status variables
          • Load configuration from the statusConfig.xml if necessary
          • Test for a readonly file system and set status
          • Load and parse values from "/proc/loadavg" to set load status values
          • Load and parse values from "/proc/meminfo" to set memory status values
          • If configured test and set status for operational soffice
          • Test and set the status value if the inode utilization is greater than 90%
          • Load the disk space information from /zpdata/logs/df.txt and set status values
            (/zpdata/logs/df.txt is maintained by /opt/zpaper/bin/status.sh).
          • Compare the current disk space with the previous disk space usage to alarm if the rate of usage increase would result in 100% utilization within 30 minutes
          • The configuration file is consulted to iterate over all the configured queue directories
            • Compare the age of the oldest file in the directory with the threshold defined in the queue configuration
            • Compare the number of files in the directory with the threshold defined in the queue configuration
            • Summarize the queue status in the details, and list the first and last 5 files in descending age order
            • Aggregate the queue status in a total queue status for later determination of overall server status
          • Pull and detail the tomcat thread status. Detail number of threads. (Note that neither number nor age is reported as a bad status)
          • The configuration file is consulted to iterate over all the server 'buddies'
            • send and Http request to the remote server with a "?ping=<randomnumber> to determine wether the buddy is alive
              • report as dead if a buddy does not respond or responds with a bad value
          • TODO Check Agent status details
          • TODO Check for disabled sessions
          • TODO If authorized user access add /zpdata/logs/statusServerDetails.txt to details (collected by crontab invocation of status.sh)
          • TODO RequestTrack status details
          • TODO Check system service status (e.g. soffice)
          • TODO Aggregate and calculated overall server status details
          • TODO Update StatusHistory and report to zPaper if appropriate

      • loadConfig

        void loadConfig(javax.servlet.ServletContext application)
        Called at the beginning of every status.jsp invocation to load the class level configuration variables. This method tests the lastModified of the configuration file and reloads the configuration data if that file has changed. The configuration file is defined by the StatusConfigFilePath init parameter of the context file. The default value is typically /zpdata/conf/statusConfig.xml.
        Parameters:
        application - the ServletContext

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the referenced file can be modified.
